Reviews.Title: “Authentic and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tumper
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in February and loved it.I chose it because i wanted somewhere small and authentic in easy walking distance of everything.It was homely and friendly and we speak English,Spanish and Portuguese and were suprised to find there was someone who could communicate in each of these languages. The breakfasts were abundant and we went everywher on foot.The flosting flower market,the Rembrant museum,the Van Gogh museum,Madam Tussaud's and the shops were within a 30 mins easy walking distance. Also even though we had a lovely oom on the 1st floor overlooking the canal from the bed it was quiet and warm in Feb.. The only dissapointment was the bathroom which was tiny and a bit dark but the shower and loo were all very cleanm and working well. I will go back as soon as i can afford to and friends of mine from Spain have gone ther since and agree it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional, central, obliging”
Reviews.Author: d_jackman
Reviews.Content: This charming place had all we needed for a 4-night stay. it's 15 minutes walk from the Central Station, beside a quiet canal (the Singel), with very little traffic, yet only 3 or 4 minutes froim Dam Square. We had a third floor room at the front ( lovely view) with ensuite. The room was small, but quite adequate for our needs. Everything was comfortable and clean and the tiny ensuite was newly installed and spotless, with a decent shower. It was not too small for us but might be for anyone taller/wider or less abled, although the 3 flights of steep stairs would limit the latter. The stairs didn't bother us. If you want a lift, stay at the Ibis! Breakfast was fine- plenty of bread, cereals, boiled eggs, ham, cheese etc and good coffee from a machine that seems to grind each cup fresh. The receptionist (Bruno) was very friendly and helpful- checking restaurants etc on Google and phoning them to check availability. Prices were, if anything, slightly less than competing places. We would certainly stay again and will recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good central base for exploring Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: Smithfield-Building
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the hotel with a friend. Brilliant location and friendly staff. Rooms are very compact but this is Amsterdam! These are traditional buildings. Shower and toilet was in a wet room, looked brand new and was clean. Looking to go back to Amsterdam again soon and would definitely book this hotel again. If you read reviews of people saying the rooms were small etc they really should be stopping in a Hilton at the airport or something. It's part of the Amsterdam experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet yet central hotel”
Reviews.Author: dabullar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice on separate occasions. Our first night in Amsterdam we booked a room here. It is an easy walk from Central Station (if your bag's not too heavy). The man checking us in spoke fluent English and was very helpful with a map, showing us different points of interest. We had already booked the rest of our week in other hotels, but when we decided to extend our stay in Amsterdam by one night, we chose to return to Hoksbergen. Our first night stay was in a very small room, but fairly typical of Amsterdam hotels. The window looked out on a canal and road, yet it was completely quiet at night. The bathroom was small (similar to a bathroom in an RV), had nothing more than the essentials, had very poor water pressure, but was spotlessly clean. On our return visit, we were placed in a different room which was much bigger with a decent sized bathroom and excellent shower. Breakfast was delicious; a little better than the standard Dutch breakfasts provided by hotels. You are allowed to serve yourself and the buffet is kept stocked and fresh. Very good coffee. Highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for Amsterdam accommodations in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Alex B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hoksbergen is located in the very center of Amsterdam at a beautiful and calm channel. Breakfast is average, the rooms are a bit small, especially the bath was really small but completely new on the other hand. The beds were a little hard. The personnel was really nice. In total I am satisfied with the hotel and I can imagine to stay there another time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Teeny room.”
Reviews.Author: SDTrav12
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful service and a great location right on the Singel Canal...close to sights; close to shopping; a short taxi-ride from the train stations; some great nearby restaurants; and a block away from a post-office. Stairs and landings were fairly narrow and our room was perhaps the smallest room I have ever stayed in; I think if we'd both stretched our arms out we could have touched each wall, and it was difficult to find room for two suitcases. The bathroom was small and dated, but it was clean. Hoksbergen pales a bit in comparison to the larger, classier hotel right next door. That said though, it was clean and convenient and overall not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “worn out. Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: kika1969
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a same problems like many others in Amsterdam. Rooms are tiny, high stairs, narrow corridors and building is old. Our room was small. We barely managed to open our suitcases. Bathroom was a tiny too. Breakfast was included the price, it was really basic, bread, coffee, cheese some cereals. But we managed to get our stomacks full. Stuff was extremely helpful

Reviews.Title: “Its Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Bauers76
Reviews.Content: There were some good points and some bad points to this hotel. Good - in a great neighbourhood, close to everything. Breakfast was ok and the price was reasonable (for Amsterdam). Staff were friendly and helpful Bad - The room was small and the bathroom was scary. Had a shower and the floor was so rotten in the shower I felt like I was going to fall through it. Had to find a good footing and then stay in that postion. Rooms badly in need of some updating and need some sort of sound proofing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, but tremendous location”
Reviews.Author: JohnLackland01
Reviews.Content: This little family-run hotel has an average standard in almost every way except for it's tremendous location, along a pitoresque canal and only a few hundred meters off Damm Square and with both Red Light District and Leidseplein within walking distance. The rooms are small and not meant to stay in, but relatively clean, and towels are changed every day if you require. Bed sheets were changed after three nights. You are also best off if you travel light as the steps are steep and there's no elevator, i.e. this may not be the place to bring your old parents. The staff is service-minded and multi-lingual. NB! The reception desk close at 22:00, so notice in advance if you arrive later, and the clerk will wait for you. For a week-end stay this is a very good bid if you are not too hung-up in luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Small!”
Reviews.Author: Jackstrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, and not big fans! Room on 3rd floor w/canal view which we paid extra for. As we were on an extended vacation we had lots of luggage going up 3 flights of steep narrow stairs. We have more room in our RV bathroom than in the room. Have to open the door to brush teeth. Breakfast ok. On plus side, Jay at the counter was super. Close to local attractions. Will find another hotel if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Canal front close to Dam and in old town.”
Reviews.Author: rscott1220
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 350 years old and well kept. Stayed three nights in a canal front room. Short 10 min walk to Dam, but street tram is around the corner. Room 10 overlooked the canal, was less than 10x10 feet with very small bathroom. We were offered a larger room, but declined and found room very acceptable as place to sleep not live. Men over 6'1' and 230 might find bathroom too small, Best suited for backpackers with 1 small suitcase. VERY steep stairs with narrow treads. Continental breakfast was fair and adequate. Free Wifi! Quiet neighborhood. Desk staff exceptionally friendly with great suggestions and help. Would definitely stay here again due to central location and great value for two-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “canal front”
Reviews.Author: 1robert63
Reviews.Content: stayed here one night, canal front room, easy access to all the attractions. staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke very good English. Would recommend very highly.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: soulmusikman
Reviews.Content: quiet location, but only 5 mins from Dam square. rooms were clean with en-suite, but perhaps a bit basic stairs were very steep. price incl breakfast, which was good staff good would use again, for long weekend, may want something better for longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant family owned hotel in a lovely location.”
Reviews.Author: Eliza-Jane29
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Amsterdam and I consider myself very lucky to have been pointed in the direction of this little hotel by the Tourist Office, located directly outside the Central Railway Station. This is a 2 star hotel located on one of Amsterdam's beautiful canals - easily within walking distance of the station or 3 stops on the tram. I extended my stay, so ended up moving rooms, staying in a double on the 3rd floor, a single on the 1st floor and a twin on the 2nd floor - all rooms overlooked the canal - a really lovely sight at night and then in the morning. The boats on the canal and the cyclists on the road beneath my windows did not disturb me at all and I had the windows open all night. The reception staff were extremely helpful - going out of their way to show me places of interest on the map and give me directions, the rooms are very basic (no air conditioning but windows open and fans in each room) but clean - the 2nd and 3rd floor rooms had the prettiest views, the breakfast room is pleasant, with a good choice of food - breakfast finishes at 10 am but coffee and food was still available and guests still eating a lot later - so a relaxed atmosphere. I paid 105 Euros for the double room and 84 Euros for the single and the twin - prices included breakfast and local taxes. There is a much plusher hotel right next door, (with exactly the same views over the canal), so I decided to compare prices. I was offered a single room at 185 Euros, excluding breakfast and taxes, so I realised how lucky I was to have found my hotel, in what seems to me to be a very expensive city when it comes to hotel accommodation! I walked everywhere from this hotel with no difficulty whatsoever - it is close to Anne Frank's house, the flower market, Dam Square and involves a longer walk along beautiful canals to the Museum area. I walked back alone from a late boat trip at about 11.15 pm on Saturday night and felt safe amongst other walkers and cyclists. When I left and headed to the station, I caught a tram from 2 streets behind the hotel - purchasing my ticket on board the tram - cost - 2.6 Euros. The hotel had told me a taxi would cost about 15-18 Euros as it was a short journey. This is not a hotel where you can relax in lounges and bars - there is just the breakfast room - but if you want somewhere to sleep, shower and have breakfast, at a reasonable price in a pricey city and then spend your time out and about - enjoying beautiful Amsterdam - it's perfect. I would strongly recommend this hotel but with one reservation - it is an old canal house and as such has extremely steep narrow stairs up to the rooms - adding to its charm and character - but there is no elevator, so if you do plan to stay in this hotel - it would be a good idea to travel light - trying to get large, heavy suitcases up and down the stairs would not be much fun! I think you would probably end up unpacking downstairs and leaving the bulk of your luggage in the room behind reception, where I noticed the hotel let visitors leave luggage if they arrived before rooms had been cleaned or wanted to look around Amsterdam and leave later in the day. The hotel staff do help with luggage but there is no doorman or porter on duty. If you intend to stay in any of the canal house hotels, it's probably worth checking if there is an elevator if you have any difficulty climbing and descending extremely steep stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Old Canal House”
Reviews.Author: CK2009
Reviews.Content: We spent the last night of our recent European trip in Amsterdam, this time staying at the Hotel Hoksbergen. Airport to train to tram to a 5-minute walk to the hotel. Quite small; we had a "large" room on the 1st floor up a steep, I mean steep, set of stairs. Very plain room; one double bed, one single for the 3 of us. Comfortable; windows opened (no a/c but it was only about 68 degrees (F) in mid-July. Suprisingly quiet; not much street noice. And very pleasant to look out the high windows to view the canal, the bike riders, etc. Fairly decent continental breakfast (included in price) in the morning. 5 minute walk to the Flower Market; 10 minute tram to the Van Gogh Museum or to the Central train station. Fairly expensive for such a plain hotel, but in Amsterdam, it was about as good a deal as you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location and friendly”
Reviews.Author: CrispyRice
Reviews.Content: This little hotel has an amazing location, and the innkeepers are amazingly friendly. It's on the Singel canal, about a 5 minute walk from the main Dam square in one direction, or the Spui in the other direction, and about 10 minutes to the Anne Frank house. There are tons of restaurants and even a large grocery store (Albert Heijn) within a couple blocks. The desk clerks were also so helpful and friendly. Breakfast was included; it was simple - toast, meat, jam, coffee, juice, hard-cooked eggs, muesli - but tasty. Wi-Fi was also free throughout the hotel. The rooms, however, were definitely dated and small. My room reminded me vaguely of an indoor cabin on cruise ship...from the 70s. Yes, it had a window, but it was basically a room that just fit two twin beds and a minuscule bathroom. It was very clean, just run-down and old. There was a small TV with several English channels. Also, note that because the hotel is in one of these old canal houses, it has a series of steep staircases and no elevator. The other guests I saw were couples in their 30's and older. Definitely the museum crowd, not the party crowd. So, if you're looking to spend lots of time in the room, require pillow-top mattresses with high-thread count sheets, or need to spread out and be pampered, this isn't for you. If you're looking for a basic room with the best location at a reasonable price, then check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller21
Reviews.Content: The hotel could do with a little makeover but if you're not bothered by a little old paint, this hotel is fine for a couple if nights. It has a decent breakfast & the rooms are clean. Convenient location for checking out the sights, about 10-15mins walk from the central station.

Reviews.Title: “Near to center and still a peaceful location. Staffs were very helpful”
Reviews.Author: sumitbajaj
Reviews.Content: Because of the packed season we got the smallest room with two single beds which we joined together. But the rooms were perfect for the price. Everything needed was inside the small room. The location is 7 minutes walking from Dam Square. Very peaceful. Breakfast 8 to 10am was good enough as we are vegetarian. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. Good Trouble free Internet connection via wi-fi for free. Overall very enjoyable experience for us. I think there wasn't any exhaust inside the toilet of the room in which we stayed which was a problem because the room was small. Without luggage its a 10 to 15 minutes walk from Amsterdam Central Station to the Hotel. It took us 25 minutes with heavy luggage to walk from the hotel to Amsterdam Central Station. Will stay here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location, poor room”
Reviews.Author: TwoTravelers99
Reviews.Content: Cons: This was our second trip to the Hoksbergen. The first time we had a nice sized room on the canal and thought we would get a similar room this time. We made our reservation in December for six nights in May, which we thought would be plenty of notice for a nice room. We were stunned that we were given such a tiny room, especially for the length of our stay. There was no room to unpack your suitcase or anything else. We are very familiar with European hotels, but this was ridiculous. We were charged the same rate as those who had rooms twice the size, which does not seem fair. The bathroom was so small that a person with a weight problem would not have been able to get to the toilet. Fortunately, we are not overweight. You also have to open the bathroom door to lean over the sink to wash your face or brush your teeth. We were well aware of the steep stairs, so we did not have an issue with that, trecherous as it is, Pros: The location is great. You are within walking distance of so much of what your came to Amsterdam to see. The staff, (the hotel is family run) could not have been nicer, which was the experience we had last time, also, The breakfast was very good and traditional Dutch. Also, it is nice to have a view of the canal, but drunks were riding up and down screaming late into the night, which certainly disturbes your sleep. We recommend this hotel but with reservations. We would only stay if we could be guaranteed a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: The-M0M0
Reviews.Content: This room was booked by friends of ours and the hotel is a typical tourist hotel. The room was on the first floor and a three person room with one extra bed. No extra charge and remembering where you are, a good deal. It was clean, everything worked and bath (shower) and toilet in the room. We where only in the hotel to sleep so we didn't mind that the room was small. The staff was friendly and correct. A nice hotel in the heart of Amsterdam and that's all it is. But that parking.......

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: attours
Reviews.Content: Near city center, within walking distance of train station, many sites and eating options. Staff was friendly and helpful with our many questions. Breakfast was included and made for a great start to our days (cereal, toast, granola, yogurt, fruit, coffee, tea and hard-boiled eggs). Would stay here again if we return to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but can do better”
Reviews.Author: martandvic
Reviews.Content: hotel was in a nice spot and rooms were clean and tidy. Main thing wasbreakfast where i think the owners could provide more choice. Staff were attentive though and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location..”
Reviews.Author: twocanadians2010
Reviews.Content: Great location in beautiful neighbourhood. Yummy breakfast: eggs, breads, meats, cheeses, cereals, juices and coffee/tea. Staff was friendly and helpful. Had a lovely room on the top floor over looking the canal. Room was a bit on the small side, but enough to fit two people comfortably. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms and uninvited guests”
Reviews.Author: mackyUK
Reviews.Content: Booked for a 5 night stay in late May 2010 but checked out after one night because of mice in our room. The owner claimed that they had been some recent strikes with waste collection services that caused a buildup of refuse prior to our arrival, I accepted the owners excuse but what I did not accept what heâ€™s attempt to try and haggle over the final bill. The Hotel Hoksbergen is more of a B&B than a hotel, the breakfast is OK but the rooms are tiny, the bathrooms are almost impossible to move around in and stairs require very careful navigation. The location of the hotel is great but any building located in the Spui area of Amsterdam is too. The hotel is around 50 Euros a night cheaper than some of the neighboring hotels but it is still not worth staying here, my advice is to stay a little further afield or pay a bit extra but avoid this grubby B&B.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MtHoodweaver
Reviews.Content: Great location, delightful helpful owners, everyone could walk to whatever they wanted to see or do. Area filled with pubs, restaurants,shops just a wanderer's dream. Rooms very tiny, but they did the job. Stairs steep, you learn to navigate them. Breakfast room only common area, owners put the teapot on as we made it our community room to share with other travelers, play cards and visit. Our group was a mix of ages, 70-36, 8 in all and everyone loved the place because of its helpful staff and location....we could walk and explore everywhere. No frills, once in your room you had to lie on your bed, my motorhome is bigger, but worth it and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: FaithNorfolk_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2009 and would not stay again. The room was tiny and the canal was right in front - there was noise all night long and I could not sleep. I tried to close the window but could not - and so I asked the man at the desk to close it for me. He was not pleased about doing so - and the following day when I came back to my room after a day out the window had been opened again. Because of the attitude of the previous day I did not like to ask for it to be once more closed and so I had to put up with the 24 hour noise from outside. There was an ensuite bathroom but I did not like to use the electrical sockets because they were loose and seemed unsafe. The bed was on a slant and the mattress was hot because of the plastic undersheet. On the positive side, the hotel was in a pretty and convenient location, and the breakfasts were very good indeed. The coffee was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, Friendly Staff, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: dsmtravelgal
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Hoksbergen in October 2009. We found this hotel in the Rick Steves 2009 Guidebook for Amsterdam, Brussels and Bruges. The hotel is an old canal house that was converted for guest rooms. The rooms are very small and the bathrooms are even smaller. However, the location is excellent and if you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your hotel room then this is the perfect place to stay. The staff was very nice and helpful. Breakfast was great. This is not a luxury hotel - the rooms are small and clean. There are a lot of very steep stairs so if you have difficulty with stairs this hotel is not for you. Overall, this hotel was a great value and we loved the location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian_boyandgirl
Reviews.Content: Hi! We stayed at hotel Hoksbergen in juli 2009 for 4 nights. Me and my girlfriend went too amsterdam for shopping, sightseeing and vacation. We had a very plessant stay here since the location is perfect! The hotel is placed in a very charming, quiet, clean, romantic street in the center of amsterdam. It took us about 3 minutes too walk into the main shopping streets, and it took us 30 sec to walk into "the 9 streets". (The 9 streets is a area with designer-shops and cafe's. Very nice!!!!) The hotel is a typically dutch kanal-house witch is 5 stores high. Inside it has a very cosy atmosfere with a very helpful staff!!! The staires is very steep, but a little exercise between all the shopping is good for your health;) The rooms and bathrooms are quite small, but large enough too sleep, rest and get clean in! If you are planning too stay inside your hotel room i would recomend you to find another hotel. This is not a luxurious hotel with all kind of services, but a cosy, clean and typically dutch kanal-hotel!!!! If you are planning too explore amsterdam, go shopping and eat at resturants, i can surely recomend this hotel! If you're going: - have an empty travelbag!!! (Lot's and lot's of shopping) - Se the red light district -Take a kanal boat-trip -Rent a bike and enjoy the ride -Buy a bottle of vine and some cheese and have a picnic wherever u want We loved amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD service, clean, basic, best part of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Norwayfamily
Reviews.Content: 5 friends, women 40+, just returned from 3 Nights at Hotel Hoksbergen. The hotel is in 4 flours, with 14 rooms. We were looking for a basic place just in this area ( lots of nice bars, restaurants, shops, silent streets, few cars, a good view to the Singel canal, everything in walking distance.) Hoksbergen had it all. In our Lonely planet guide it says that; even sardines would have trouble squising into the microscopically small rooms; We are large womens from scandinavia and managed well; Service is good, beds are good, steps are steep, always good for heart!. Breakfast was good, the coffee could have been better, thats our only complain. We would all go back, next time with our husbands and childrens, knowing that we will be having another exellent stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely basic”
Reviews.Author: keely_63
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it looked so nice from the outside, great location on a canal. The reception area was small but we just wanted to see the room. We were given room 1, straight up the stairs!!! Upon walking in it was tiny, it was a box room, the toilet next door was bigger! So my partner went straight downstairs and lied about it being my birthday and it was meant to be a romantic holiday. We were meant to be there for 3 nights but the man behind the counter was very understanding and let us stay just 1 night and we found somewhere else for the remaining 2 nights. It would be fine for 1 night quick stay but not for a romantic break. It was 98 Euros that is expensive for what you get, we went to a 4 star the remaining 2 nights for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel on a canal”
Reviews.Author: SaxyfromAubrey
Reviews.Content: OK, let's start with the negatives. The rooms are small, the bathrooms are smaller and the stairs are steep and narrow. However the location is great - right on the Singel canal close to Spui. When you make your reservation ask for a room facing the canal. You can walk to any of the major tourist areas in 15 minutes at the most. The Koninkijk Palaeis is 5 minutes away or less and the flower market no more than 10. We loved the location. The staff was friendly and were great with restaurant recommendations and suggestions as to what to do. Boris and the boys will take good care of you. They will willingly carry your bags up and down the stairs. Flying in from the US we got there well before our rooms were ready so we were allowed to keep our bags in the back room which was relatively secure. When we go back to Amsterdam - and we will - we will go back to Hotel Hoksbergen or one very close to it. This was the first stop on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ellis40
Reviews.Content: For Amsterdam this was a reasonably priced hotel, but the rooms are a little dated. I would stop here again but I do think its a little overpriced for what you get (which I guess is true for any hotel in Amsterdam). The breakfast I thought was excellent but the stairs are very steep and if you have any mobility problmes this is not the hotel for you. It is centrally located and easy to find, its only 5 minutes walk from Dam square and assuming that you haven't much luggage is walkable from the Central Station. I found the owners/ staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: whyner
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to the Hoksbergen since January 06, but i must say that i'm surprised at the majority of the reviews... i found he hotel wonderful...the food was just fine, the reception was very warm, though i do agree that they had no idea of any tourist information... but you can find all that elsewhere easily. the rooms were totally outdated, but clean and the beds were made every day. the stairs were steep, but c'mon people, this is an old city... an old hotel...not the mariott... anyway, i thought the location was excellent and like it so much that i'm thinking of going back there this may. This time I have a group and will probably choose an apartment. Does anyone know if the owners/proprietors have changed since 2006? Just wondering.

Reviews.Title: “the hoksbergen”
Reviews.Author: irishguy1888
Reviews.Content: Hi all I have stayed in the hoksbergen a few times i have to say its basic but comfortable rooms are small but very clean witch is the main thing with me. staff i found very pleasent and alwasy rember us when we go back and they always give us a discount when we go back to them. its located in a great a quite street one small street away from dam square bars restaruants and ngt life. the main shopping street is just a 4 min walk away so is the museums redlight and coffee shops. the one and only problem i had with this hotel is the stairs they are very steep and hard on the legs if you on top floor (witch we always get lol) other than that ive no probs with it if your just looking for a budget hotel been to others that were cheaper but they were out of the way and were dumps. one thing about the hoksbergens location is it very safe

Reviews.Title: “No major problems”
Reviews.Author: Nattals
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for everyone, but it worked for my husband and me. Let's start with the negative aspects. The room was extremely small - we had about 2 feet of floor space between the bed and the walls - barely enough room for our suitcase. But, we were not shocked by this as the owners (Xia/Bruno/Bert) had explained that the rooms were small. They also explained that the stairs were very steep. They are a little scary to be honest, and climbing them was a workout. If you have physical limitations or are in poor health, you will have a difficult time with the stairs. The bathroom was also very small - I am 5' 3" and my knees touched the wall when I sat on the toilet. The last negative - the mattress was not very comfortable. It was not unbearable. Again, if you have back problems or need an excellent mattress, stay at another hotel. Now for the positives - we knew all the possible issues before we ever arrived at the Hoksbergen because the owners were very honest about their hotel. I asked a lot of questions and you should too, regardless of where you stay. The room was very clean and was made up every morning. The bedspread was old but clean, and the sheets were crisp and white. I am very picky in this area and did not have any issue. The breakfast was similar to an American continental breakfast. There was coffee, tea, toast, boiled eggs, lunchmeat and cheese, fruit, cereal, etc. It's included in the room price. The canal view is beautiful! The windows open wide and you can sit on the large windowsill and relax. There are pretty flower boxes on the windows too - a nice touch. Lastly, the owners were efficient and helpful. They called for a taxi when we asked, helped with directions, and recommended restaurants. I recommend emailing the hotel and asking any questions in advance so you know what to expect. That's the key to a happy stay!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Hoksbergen”
Reviews.Author: edge_travels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Hoksbergen for 4 nights at the end of September 2007. Upon arriving, I was quite charmed by the location and exterior of the hotel, the entry/breakfast room was also quaint. The man who checked us in however, was mildly unpleasant. Although there was another man who helped us throughout our stay who was quite friendly. The biggest disappointment came upon opening the door to our room, after walking up two flights of steep stairs. The room was stark, but not in a modern sense. It seemed to date from the 70's, the walls were plain for the most part. The linens appeared to date from the 70s, yet were not tattered. The biggest surprise came when we pulled back the bedspread to find a fleece blanket with a tiger printed across it, with a mysterious brownish stain towards the top. The bathroom was covered with brown linoleum and smelled too strongly of toilet disinfectant. We seriously considered finding a new hotel the next day. We decided against it primarily because the room was basically clean and comfortable and our primary objections were about the decor, or lack thereof. The breakfast was fine and included a choice of coffee or tea, breads, sandwich meats, cereal, among other simple choices. The location was the saving grace of this hotel, located on the Spui and within easy walking distance of all locations within the historic area of town. This was not my first choice of hotels to book when planning our trip, but I soon found that the other 10 or so hotels I was considering were booked. I spent more on this hotel per night than any others during our trip to Europe (London, Brugge, Paris), which added an extra sting to my disappointment with the room. Despite our accommodations, we fell in love with Amsterdam. If we are lucky enough to visit Amsterdam in the future, we will plan well in advance and will not book at Hotel Hoksbergen.

Reviews.Title: “Worst value ever! Dirty and small!”
Reviews.Author: pnova
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump! Rude people own it and they treat their customers, especially Americans, like garbage. 8 of us went to Amsterdam on separate flights for a bachelor party; we were to meet up at the Hoksbergen, which is where we were all staying. We had two rooms. I was with the bachelor and one other friend when we arrived at the hotel. We checked in and asked the man for our friends room so we could meet up (there are two separate buildings, a few blocks apart, we stayed in separate ones and did not know where the other was). He told us no, he would not give it away b/c he didn't like people like us (mid 20 year olds) hanging out in groups in Amsterdam. None of us had cell phone or any form of communication. We pleaded with the man to at least call their room and tell them we arrived, he said no. When we came back an hour later he said our friends were making noise and he told them to be quiet - but did not mention a word about us arriving. We were never able to meet up with them for the three days we were there. The place was a rip off. The rooms (ours for three people) was about 8x8 with three tiny beds about an inch think mattress covered in plastic. There were insects all over the room and cigarette butts on the floor. The bathroom was far too small to fit in - aside from its microscopic area it had a 5 - 1/2 foot ceiling; literally, Iâ€™m 6 foot and could not stand up in it. Of course no A/C, which we were, told there was. We refused to stay there, left and stayed at a real nice hotel right in front of the train station. This was in a better location, was a real hotel, unlike the Hoksbergen hostel, and was less than the Hoksbergen. Do yourself a favor and donâ€™t stay at the Hoksbergen, there are way too many nice hotels in Amsterdam with a much better value and experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: coffeepot/NJ
Reviews.Content: Hoksbergen is excellently located along the pretty Singel canal. Unfortunately, our room faced the back, and Spui is a noisy street. There was also an active construction site directly below the window. The room (luckily, on the first floor, up just one flight of narrow stairs) was small, with two single beds pushed together. The beds were fairly comfortable, seemed to be thick foam mattesses. The very tiny bathroom has a decent shower, with plenty of hot water, but they use some sort of perfumey disinfectant cake in the toilet that made the entire room reek. The lighting in the room is terrible, and there is basically no decor to speak of (tho there is a flat-panel TV on the wall). And it could have been a little cleaner. Breakfast was nothing special; the coffee was okay. (There's a good bakery and a sandwich/breakfast place right around the corner.) The hotel staff were pleasant . It's pretty much what you'd expect for the money: adequate, but I wouldn't recommend it for more than a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “you can get a lot more for your money elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: traveltinker
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in Amsterdam a few times and this hotel is the worst value for money i have stayed in yet. As a budget traveller my expectations are never very high but i have stayed in far nicer and cheaper hotels than this. I booked a double room for me and my husband. However when we arrived at the hotel we were given a twin room. we were told we could just push the beds next to each other but this was impossible as there was a door in the way! the man on reception made no effort to help us and consequently we were stuck in separate beds for the night- not that nice for a couple who have only been married for a few months! The room itself was incredibley pokey and for the price of 98 euros an absolute rip off! My advice to any traveller on a budget is to head for Hotel Brouwer up the road where it's 90 euros for a great large double room with old wooden beams and a great breakfast. Also Hotel Acacia in the Joordan is miles better than Hotel Hoksbergen at 80 euros for a big double bedroom with a canal view. If you're absolutely pushed go here but there are so many more better budget options than this about!

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: HallucinoJenn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in July. Upon my arrival early in the morning my room was not yet ready but I was allowed to sit in the dining room and enjoy a simple breakfast. Several hours later the room was ready. It was a very small room but had all necessities. Sleeping was very uncomfortable. I found the bed to be very hot not because of the blankets or the weather but because of the plastic mattress cover. The hotel is in a great location and has easy access to public transit and attractions. I checked out on a Sunday morning but was told that I could leave my luggage at the hotel until Monday evening. My luggage was brought down for me. When I returned to the hotel Monday evening the man working at the desk was extremely rude to me. He was speaking to me in a voice that was full of sarcasm. He told me no one knew to whom the luggage belonged as I had just left the hotel without telling anyone. I explained to him that I had spoken to the other hotel operator and that man had assured me that it was fine to leave my bags. This second man then informed me that the first man had not understood me. He kept interrupitng me when I was speaking and was treating me like a small child. I left that hotel in tears and will never again stay there. Although two of the three men working there were very friendly this third man was extremely rude and condescending. I gave them a bottle of maple syrup as a small tip to which they did not say thank you or even acknowledge the gestrue. Given the number of hotelsin Amsterdam with similar access to transit and attractions I will never again stay at the Hoksbergen. I am sad to say that this man's attitude ruined the hotel for me. It had been acceptable. The breakfast was fair although not extravegant. The rooms were small although not overly clean. I advise travelers to find a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: llyons02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights this past July. We found the hotel to be of good value. The location is great. It is very convenient to almost all major tourist spots. The staff is extremely helpful and willing to find information for you if they do not know immediately. The bedroom and bathroom are both of ample size. This is a simple hotel with very few bells and whistles. A great place to come and put your head down at night (after you make the steep climb to your room). It is not the place for you if you are looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great Centrally Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bballer21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartments that are around the corner from the actual hotel. Great breakfast/pastry shop across the canal, about 100 yards probably. Safe and clean area around the hotel. No more than a 20 minute walk to the tourist attractions in all directions. Also about a 20-25 minute walk to the train station and not hard to find. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely rude!”
Reviews.Author: Mattradamus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Hoksbergen with friends last September, despite having read bad reviews before I left UK, I went ahead and stayed there. Our stay was very basic and unclean, but bareable. The appartment was very small and dingy, the cups had dead flies in them and the kettle had tobacco in it when we arrived. The room wasn't cleaned once in our 5 day stay, but this was fine and we didn't mind that so much. I was desperate for somewhere to stay when booking another stay this September as we are on a strict budget. I rang again to enquire about accomodation availability and the receptionist answered the phone in Dutch. I then asked if they spoke english (I knew they would, but I just wanted to be polite), this was met with a short pause and then "of course I speak english you idot", I felt that this was completely out of order and inexcusable. I had not made an effort to offend him in anyway, and the least he could have done was to show me the same courtesy back. I will never be staying at Hotel Hoksbergen again, and in fact I have been fortunate enough to book another apartment which is much cleaner, has had much better reviews, is more central and similarly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: JojoBrazil
Reviews.Content: After searching for hotels in every single wesite, I decided to stay at Hoksbergen Hotel with my boyfriend based on the good reviews I saw on Trip Advisor. The hotel is realy great, our room wasn't very small, on the 2nd floor, with a good TV, big window and good bathroom. The shower was wonderful. The water was very hot and the pressure was great. The crew was very very very helpful, we asked for their help in many occasions and they always helped us. The breakfast was great, I'm from Brazil and here we don't have the habit of eating hot stuff. I should definetilly stay again in Hoksbergen Hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Reccomended”
Reviews.Author: danarb
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Hoksbergen by searching TripAdvisor and were very pleased. The hotel was very cute and in the best location ever! There are plenty of nice shops and restaurants in the area. We had one of the best chocolate tortes that we have ever eaten just around the corner from the hotel. There is an Italian restaurant down the street (along the Single Canal) called Casa Di David that was wonderful. Also along the canal was Orange Bike Rentals. The owner was so nice. My husband and I wanted to rent bikes after he was already closed, and unfortunately were leaving for our flight in the morning before the bike shop would reopen. The owner allowed us to keep the bikes overnight and chain them in front of Hotel Hokesbergen, the front desk attendent kept the key. He allowed us to do this without keeping our ID for colladeral which is typical. The hotel was in such a beautiful area that one night we decided not to venture far and walked, ate dinner, sat in cafes, all within a few blocks of the hotel. The rooms are typical for Europe (small), but very clean. Should we return to Amsterdam, we will certainly stay in Hotel Hokesbergen.

Reviews.Title: “Back for a second visit, memorable property!”
Reviews.Author: BANewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hoksbergen has become a part of my yearly visit to Amsterdam. Last there in October 2005 this property is due a great review for making my second visit a memorable trip. Visiting from New York with two collegues all employed with British Airways we all booked separate rooms. The daily rate was reasonable and as usual the the accommodations were clean and comforatble. My room afforded a great view of the canal. A retreat from New York City life! All of my collegues were extremely pleased. We spent 4 nights (February 11th thry 15th) celebrating my birthday with activities in this beautiful city. The breakfasts were fresh & healthy with plentiful food and drink. The hotel is located within walking distance of many downtown attractions. The hotel is located in a 17th century canal house on the main canal. Staff is very helpful with travel tips and maps and is always ready to advise us on where to go & what to see. We have already agreed to return this October/November and will surely book this property again. We book directly from the hotel website. It is truly wonderful to have discovered this property! John Panella British Airways Sales Department New York City

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rickandjude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in November during our Around the World Trip. The hotel is in a sensational position close to all the major places. The room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast was excellent. The only MINOR downside was the stairs were steep and narrow. This meant two trips rather than one-a very minor discomfort. The staff were really helpful and all in all it is an excellent value for money Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For the money it was great”
Reviews.Author: montanan_traveler
Reviews.Content: I had hoped to stay at the Hotel Brouwer but it was full so I stayed at the Hotel Hoksbergen which I found on Tripadvisor.com The rooms are very small but are ensuite. The free breakfast is excellent as is the location. It is a small canal house right on the canal. Great restaurants close by and within easy walking distance of most tourist destinations. For the money it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: nbarlics
Reviews.Content: From the US... First off, we just happened to travel to Europe when they were having what they called heatwave. We were in Amsterdam from approx July 23-27 i think? but around those dates. The hotel doesnt have air, but our room was equipped with a huge wall fan that worked excellent. What we did, is left the window open ALL day, but closed the curtain, kept the fan on and it was perfect by the time we came back to sleep. We also left the window open at night with the fan on low and we were freezing!!! The canal view rooms had gorgeous views... we stayed in room 14. There is no elevator and the stairs sorta twist on the way up so you have to be careful. Not all rooms have there own bathroom. There was a delicious little breakfast every morning... toast, hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, tea, coffee... for free... the rooms were a bit tiny but perfect for a couple!! There are only 14 rooms, so try not to wait to the last minute to book it. We booked probably 2 weeks in advance and we were ok... but i think we got lucky!!! Also - it was SOOOOOOO CLEAN!!!! It is family owned adn they really take pride in there establishment. We are planning another trip next year, and i have alreadty decided to not look anywhere else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny Itsy Bitsy Little Rooms. Good & Friendly Service though....”
Reviews.Author: PDXLadie
Reviews.Content: THE BAD: First off, I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone extremely overweight or elderly. I am not a very large lady, but I had to turn sideways and squeeze into the restroom. I could shave my legs atop the toilet seat while taking a shower and use the sink all at the same time! Also, trying to get up and down those steep stairs can be very hazzardous. I was terrified of falling. Although the front desk person had said that he was not aware of anyone having ever fallen down those stairs, I don't know if I really believe him..... The room itself only had room for the bed and had a flat screen TV hanging on the wall, which was nice. While we were in Amsterdam, there was an unusual heatwave going on pushing up into the 90's. Our room, on the 4th floor, was so hot, it was almost unbearable. There was no air conditioning, which is the norm in Europe, but there was barely any ventilation either because the window only opened about 12 inches and the small measly fan provided did not reach to the window. It was very hot out, but that isn't really the hotel's fault. The room had kind of an out-dated feel to it with odd bedding (one blanket was a big velour one with a large tiger and bamboo print) and cigarette burns on the carpet. THE GOOD: The location was awesome, within walking distance to a lot of the great sites, but also far enough away from Damrak and The Dam that it can be somewhat quiet and peaceful too. The view over the Singel canal is classic Amsterdam. The service was great. The two brothers working in the morning were very nice and the breakfast buffet was excellent. Toast, cheeses, meats, hard boiled eggs, a variety of cereals, coffee, juice, milk, and water. It was yummy. SUMMARY: For the price, I was expecting a little more. More specifically, larger rooms with nicer bedding/decor. BUT, I think Amsterdam is just a really expensive city and is even more so when you are from the US and have to deal with the crummy US dollar to Euro exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend this one”
Reviews.Author: EmilyFS
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we decided to stay at the Hoksbergen. The room was small but they warned us ahead. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast was nice (good hot chocolate!) and the rooms were clean. We were on the top floor (5th) and there was no lift, which was good as we were overeating in Amsterdam. The site is perfect, very central on a beautiful canal and yet peaceful at night time. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Emily and Nicholas

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty good find. I couldn't believe how close this was to the center of town (and everything else). The canal view is great. The breakfast was pretty good (ends at 10AM) and the service was friendly. They give you a key to the building so you can come and go whenever you please at any time of the day and night (this is important for me because I've stayed at places where there are curfews, and this is never enjoyable). The stairs were steep but not a problem for me. The rooms were small but not that small! (have any of the previous review writers been to Italy or Greece lately?) Anyway, this place is very clean and I'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A charming, friendly and affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: LANewsboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Hoksbergen for four days in late April, 2006, including the not-to-be-believed Queen's Day celebration, and we had a fine visit. The canal-side location was picturesque and a great base for seeing much of Amsterdam and the hosts (Bruno, especially) could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Yes, the rooms are tiny and yes, the stairs are steep, but that's all part of the charm of staying in a historic building. We had two twin beds pushed together and got a great night's sleep on them. Some others below have mentioned a problem with the smell of smoke, but we did not detect any odor, and my wife is very sensitive to smoke. The breakfast included excellent coffee, granola, cereal, bread for toast, and the standard European cheese, cold cuts and eggs. Just be forewarned: the stairs really are steep and narrow, so if you travel with several large bags it will be a challenge getting them to your room and finding a place for them once you get there. We had a good time at the hotel and would stay there again., Dick and Diane Barnes Long Beach, California, USA

Reviews.Title: “we love this place”
Reviews.Author: misspamelaphila
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times and have always been very pleased. Yes, it's small and there are a lot of steps but it's clean, the new breakfast buffet is great and the staff have always been so kind, helpful and very accommodating to their guests. The location is great and it's close to one of our favorite vegetarian restaurants on Spuistraat, Green Planet.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, location, clean, quiet...what more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: VanBC_girl
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week in Amsterdam with a girl friend for my 30th birthday. We chose the Hoksbergen based on location, price and the fact that breakfast was included. We were not disappointed. It is located a brief walk from almost everything, and it was safe, quaint, and practically silent on the streets at night for a good sleep. No young, rowdy people were staying while we were there - a lot of couples, young quiet 20-30 somethings and lone travellers. Our room was #1, the first after one flight of stairs off the hotel lobby and entry. We had no great view (only of a side street), and the room was REALLY small, but they warned us in advance since we got the last room in the place, so we were forewarned and fine with it. We had our own bathroom in our room with a shower, sink and toilet, but it was comedic how small it was!! The breakfast was nice and included toast, eggs, cereal, tea, coffee, juice, etc. More than enough to start the day. Everyone was nice and helpful. We were going to spend the other half of the week at another place, just to mix it up a bit, but after checking around at other places, nobody could beat the price and value of our room. Would definitely recommend trying for a canal view room since it will only be icing on the cake. I would stay here again, no problem! Great value if you are looking for a good deal and a nice stay. Not for the picky and high maintenance. Oh! Our room really smelled like smoke, which sucked for us since we are non-smokers, but we were also right above the office and the front desk person was a smoker, so the office smoke definitely drifted up to us. We would open the windows to clear it when we got home, but it always had a faint old smoke smell, much like a lot of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: koalacub
Reviews.Content: Thanks Xia / Bruno / Bert for making our first visit to Amsterdam a memorable one. Me, my wife and our 11 year old son had a wonderful stay here with a fab view of the canal. Most tourist attractions were nearby and Xia / Bruno / Bert were most helpful with their suggestions. The breakfast was a delightful spread. Bruno, thanks for loaning the umbrella! Hope to visit Amsterdam (or rather Hoksbergen)soon.

Reviews.Title: “My Love Affair with the Hoksbergen...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Hoksbergen is the most charming and sweetest spot along the singel canal. This pleasant peaceful place is perfect for travelers on a small budget who dont want to sacrafice cleanliness and comfort for cheap rates. My stay at the hoksbergen was magical, the free dutch continental breakfast was so tantilizing- fresh squeezed oj, ice cold water, thick fresh dutch milk, variety of cereal (the best granola i have ever had!), yummy cold cuts ham, salami, cheese, soft boiled eggs, and the most wonderful jams and a delightful selection of toasts, what more could you ask for? The double room my friend and i stayed in was completlly quaint and immaculate. Fresh towels, clean sheets, extra pillows, everything was on point. The staff were so awesome, spoke excellent english and provided us with lots of valueable tips and advise for enjoying the wonders of the lovliest city in Europe. I can not count the numerous times my friend and I discussed how much we loved the hoksbergen. The location was perfect, close to every tourist sight, yet maintains the perfect distance from the hustle bustle, and noise of city, and is very safe.My friend and I, (two nineteen year old girls), felt completly secure during our stay One of the best and oldest bars in town Gollem, is right around the corner. Great Greek food is five steps down the street, and if the continental breakfast did not fill you up, there is an excellent bakery wich serves the freshest best smelling and tasting crossaints in all of the city. Oh and for all of you spliff smokin souls, numeous, numerous coffeeshops are just a hop, skip, and jump away! Plus the staff did not seem to mind the sweetsmelling sent of sensi, whcih escaped from our room (: well once again, frommers and I both highly reccomend this hotel! My trip to the DAM would not have been so incredible if the homey hotel Hoksbergen were not in the picture. go ahead and start your own love affair...
